intro: Coussapoa vellerea, commonly known as the velvet leaf or velvet fern, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Coussapoa vellerea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and stream banks.
